children.text:
The regulations of 30-09-2012
Terms of use of the application "ICEcard"
 
§ 1 [General provisions]
1. This document, hereinafter referred to as "the Regulations", to which acceptance is the “ICEcard” user is required, hereinafter referred to as "the Application", before its installation on the user’s device, determines the terms and conditions of using this application.
2. By accepting the Regulations, the user covenants a license agreement, under the terms described in the Regulations, with the company Clusor LLC based in Warsaw, 9B Lanciego Street, 02-793 Warsaw, entered into the Registry of Entrepreneurs kept by the District Court for the Capital City of Warsaw, XIII Commercial Division of the National Court Registry with the registration code 0000389542, revenue identification number (NIP) 9512342151, enterprise registration number (REGON) 142985046, stock capital PLN 5.000, hereinafter referred to as "Clusor".
 
§ 2 [Copyrights]
1.   Clusor is the only the creator of the application.
2.	Clusor has all copyrights to the application code and also to the graphic elements of the application which form a creation, within the meaning of the Act of 4 February 1994 on copyrights and related rights (Journal Of Legal Acts 2006, No 90, item 631, as amended), as well as to the appearance of the application as a whole. Any copying, reproduction, distribution and making studies regarding the whole application or its elements, as well as the appearance of the Application as a whole, without the express written consent of Clusor, subject to the below provisions of § 3, constitutes violation of its copyrights and will encounter an immediate reaction of Clusor with down warding the copyright breacher inclusively for liability for damages.
3.	Installation and use of the application are allowed only in accordance with the principles set out in the Regulations. 
 
§ 3 [Disclaimer]
1. Clusor makes its best so that the application works correctly, however shall not bear any responsibility for 
1)	information saved by user, which was false, incorrect or incomplete, and also for the omission of relevant information
2)	incorrect or inaccurate determination of the user’s position which was determined with the help of the GPS installed on user’s device, based on the information provided by the GSM operator or information obtained from third parties, or their software
3)	failure to deliver, delay in delivery, or sending distorted information by the GSM operator or an operator of another medium
4)	factually incorrect readings of information stored or transmitted by the Application.
2. Clusor declares that the application is intended solely for private use, not related to the user's occupation, business, charity or activities carried out on behalf of third parties, whether for a consideration or free of charge.
3. Clusor declares that it has made all possible efforts to secure the Application from accidental or unwitting sending of an SMS message or of data in a different form and it is not responsible for any consequences caused by sending data in an SMS or otherwise. Application user is responsible for prudent use of data transmission.
4. Clusor declares that it does not guarantee regularity of the application functioning.
5. Clusor informs that due to software previously installed on application user’s hardware, you may experience issues with the use of the application. The solution may require the previously installed software to be removed.
6. Clusor is not responsible for proper functioning of the equipment, on which the application has been installed.
 
§ 4 [License]
1. From the moment of the Regulations acceptance, user covenants a license agreement with Clusor. On its basis, Clusor grants user a non-exclusive, unlimited neither temporarily nor territorially, paid license to use the application.
2. Using of the application is free of charge. The Application may be installed on unlimited number of user’s devices.
3. Subject to the provisions of paragraph 4, translation, adaptation, arrangement or any other changes to the application are possible only with the express, written consent of Clusor.
4. Clusor’s permission is not required:
1) making a back up copy of the Application;
2) observing, examining and testing the functioning of the Application in order to get to know its ideas and principles by the application user, if the user makes that in the course of implementation, display, use, transmission or storage of the application;
3) reproduction of the code or translation of the application, if it is needed to obtain information necessary to achieve cooperation of the independently created computer program with the application, unless the following conditions are fulfilled:
(a)) these activities are carried out by the application user or by any other person acting on his/her behalf,
(b)) information necessary to achieve cooperation has not been previously easily available for the application user,
(c)) these activities relate to those parts of the application, which are necessary to achieve cooperation.
5. The information, which is referred to in paragraph 4 section 3, may not be:
1) used for purposes other than to achieve the cooperation of the independently created computer program;
2) communicated to other persons, unless it is necessary to achieve cooperation of the independently created computer program;
3) used to develop, manufacture or marketing of a computer program with a substantially similar form of expression or for other acts violating copyrights.
6. Any other, than those referred to in the preceding paragraphs, use of the application shall constitute violation of Clusor’s copyrights.
7. Application user is not entitled to transfer the rights to use the Application to any third person, without the express written permission of Clusor.
8. Application user is not entitled to give any third party a further license to use the application.
 
§ 5 [Minimal hardware requirements]
1. Clusor indicates that the Application interacts only with the operating system: Android version 2.1 and higher. Using the application on a device which does not have the operating system referred to in the preceding sentence, is not possible – it is necessary to download version of the application which is proper for the operating system installed on the user's device, if Clusor provides such version of the application. 
2. Clusor indicates that using the Application is possible only on devices that meet the following hardware requirements: processor 250 MHz, 128 MB RAM.
 
§ 6 [Final provisions]
1. Any complaints can be directed to Clusor in writing to the address specified in § 1 point 2.
2. The law, applicable to this Regulations and in particular to the license agreement referred to in § 4 point 1, is the law of the Republic of Poland, unless it opposes to the mandatory law provisions which protect consumers' interests.
3. The court, competent for resolution of any disputes between application users and Clusor, is a court of general jurisdiction competent for Clusor’s seat address, unless it opposes to the mandatory law provisions which protect consumers' interests.
